newsitem.title: POLAND: Polisa Zycie life insurer expands offer.
newsitem.headline: Polisa Zycie life insurer expands offer.

text.p: Poland's Polisa Zycie life insurer, 46-percent owned by France's Caisse Nationale de Prevoyance, is offering two new products, the firm's head said on Friday.
Henryk Chmielak told a news conference that Polisa Zycie, 26-percent owned by Polish insurer Polisa, had launched family group life insurance and a group pension scheme for firms.
"In the second half of the year we plan to start heavy promotion of our two new products, family group life insurance and a pension programme for firms," Chmielak said.
He would not say to what degree the product might help raise the firm's 0.3-percent market share.
Chmielak also said that alongside expanding its insurance offer, the company would focus on developing its branch network, personnel training and computerisation.
Polisa Zycie's assets amount to 19.2 million zlotys.
